intro: Hieracium prediliense subsp. prassbergense, commonly known as the Prassberg hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow composite flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant is native to specific regions in Central Europe and is often found in grassy habitats. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and localized species.
